required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Boston Scientific OffRoad™ Re-entry Catheter System for Subintimal Recanalization of Chronic Total Occlusions in Femoropopliteal Arteries
clinical_study.official_title: Boston Scientific OffRoad™ Re-entry Catheter System for Subintimal Recanalization of Chronic Total Occlusions in Femoropopliteal Arteries

brief_summary.textblock: Study of the OffRoad™ Re-entry Catheter System for subintimal recanalization of chronic total occlusions in native femoropopliteal arteries.

primary_outcome.measure: Composite Rate of Major Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: Composite rate of major adverse events (MAEs) related to the OffRoad System at 30 days, including: death, perforation requiring intervention, clinically significant peripheral embolism, and major amputation (amputation of the treated lower limb at the ankle level or above). Events are based on data adjudicated by a Clinical Event Committee.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Device technical success is determined during the index procedure, from the time of first puncture of the skin in order to obtain access to the artery until the time the introducer sheath is removed from the body
primary_outcome.description: Device Technical Success rate, defined as placement of a guidewire in the true lumen distal to a Chronic Total Occlusion (CTO)

other_outcome.description: All death related to the use of the OffRoad Re-entry Catheter System. Events are based on site reported Adverse Event data.
All perforation requiring intervention related to the use of the OffRoad Re-entry Catheter System. Events are based on site reported Adverse Event data.
All clinically significant peripheral embolisms related to the use of the OffRoad Re-entry Catheter System. Events are based on site reported Adverse Event data.

other_outcome.measure: Device-related Major Amputation at Ankle Level or Above of Treated Lower Limb
other_outcome.description: All Major amputations related to the use of the OffRoad Re-entry Catheter System. Events are based on site reported Adverse Event data.
All adverse events (AEs) reported by the centers.

Acute Procedure Success, defined as device technical success and the absence of in-hospital Major Adverse Events {death, perforation requiring intervention, clinically significant peripheral embolism, and major amputation (amputation of the treated lower limb at the ankle level or above)}

other_outcome.measure: Target Lesion Revascularization Due to a Complication
other_outcome.description: Any surgical or percutaneous intervention to the target lesion(s) after the index procedure.

other_outcome.measure: Device-related Dissection, Grade C or Greater
other_outcome.description: Type A- Small radiolucent area within the lumen of the vessel disappearing with the passage of the contrast material. Type B- Appearance of contrast medium parallel to the lumen of the vessel disappearing within a few cardiac cycles. Type C- Dissection protruding outside the lumen of the vessel persisting after passage of the contrast material. Type D- Spiral shaped filling defect with or without delayed run-off of the contrast material in the antegrade flow. Type E- Persistent luminal filling defect with delayed run-off of the contrast material in the distal lumen.

Defined as the time when the treating physician first punctures the skin in order to obtain access to the artery to treat the target lesion until the time the introducer sheath is removed from the body.

other_outcome.measure: OffRoad System Use Length of Time
other_outcome.description: From time of "positioning balloon catheter" introduced in the body until time "final OffRoad component" removed.

arm_group.description: Participants treated with OffRoad Re-entry Catheter System

intervention.description: Facilitate the placement and positioning of guidewires within the peripheral vasculature.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Claudication or critical limb ischemia (Rutherford Category 2-5)
- Documented de novo or re-occluded Chronic Total Occlusion (CTO) (99-100% stenosed) lesion in native femoropopliteal artery
- Target vessel occlusion length is ≥ 1 cm and ≤ 30 cm
- Minimum reference vessel diameter is 4 mm
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindication to an endovascular procedure
- Previous stent placement in the target vessel
- Prior surgery of the superficial femoral artery (SFA) in the target limb to treat atherosclerotic disease
- Platelet count <150,000 mm3 or >600,000 mm3
- Renal insufficiency with a serum creatinine >2.3 mg/dl
- History of major amputation (ankle level or above) in the same limb as the target lesion
- Current participation in another drug or device clinical study

overall_official.affiliation: Herzzentrum Leipzig GmbH/ Park Krankenhaus Leipzig GmbH

participant_flow.recruitment_details: There were 92 subjects enrolled at 12 investigative centers in Belgium, Germany and Switzerland from 26 April 2012 to 16 April 2013

group.title: Re-ROUTE
group.description: All subjects who meet the inclusion criteria and are enrolled in this trial will be treated with the OffRoad™ Re-entry Catheter

group.title: Re-ROUTE
group.description: All subjects who meet the inclusion criteria and are enrolled in this trial will be treated with the OffRoad™ Re-entry Catheter

measure.title: General Medical History
measure.description: The same participant may be included in more than one category or not all participants may contribute to a category, therefore the number of participants for this baseline measure does not equal the total number of participants in the group.

class.title: History of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

measure.title: Cardiac History
measure.description: The same participant may be included in more than one category or not all participants may contribute to a category, therefore the number of participants for this baseline measure does not equal the total number of participants in the group.

class.title: History of Coronary Artery Bypass Graft

measure.title: Neurologic/Renal History
measure.description: The same participant may be included in more than one category or not all participants may contribute to a category, therefore the number of participants for this baseline measure does not equal the total number of participants in the group.

measure.title: Peripheral Vascular History
measure.description: The same participant may be included in more than one category or not all participants may contribute to a category, therefore the number of participants for this baseline measure does not equal the total number of participants in the group.

measure.title: Baseline Lesion Characteristics: Reference Vessel Diameter
Baseline Lesion Characteristics: Presence of Calcification
measure.description: Readily apparent densities seen within the artery wall and site of lesion as an x-ray-absorbing mass. The protocol does not provide the criteria for assessing lesions as "None/Mild", "Moderate", or "Severe". The assessment was left to the discretion of the Investigator.

measure.title: Baseline Lesion Characteristics: Percent of Lesions with Re-entry into true lumen (site reported)
measure.description: Re-entry in the true lumen defined as placement of a guidewire in the true lumen distal to a Chronic Total Occlusion (CTO).

measure.title: Baseline Lesion Characteristics: Percent of Lesions with Perforation requiring intervention
measure.description: Perforation defined as Angiographic Perforation (Perforation detected by the clinical center or Angiographic Core Laboratory at any point during the procedure) or clinical Perforation (perforation requiring additional treatment (including efforts to seal the perforation), or resulting in significant hemodynamic compromise, abrupt closure, or death).

measure.title: Baseline Lesion Characteristics: Percent of Lesions with Flow limiting dissection
measure.description: Type A: Small radiolucent area within vessel lumen disappearing with passage of contrast material, Type B: Appearance of contrast medium parallel to vessel lumen disappearing within a few cardiac cycles, Type C: Dissection protruding outside vessel lumen persisting after passage of contrast material, Type D: Spiral shaped filling defect with or without delayed run-off of contrast material in the antegrade flow, Type E: Persistent luminal filling defect with delayed run-off of contrast material in the distal lumen, Type F: Filling defect accompanied by total vessel occlusion.

measure.title: Procedural Characteristics: Time from artery access to sheath removal
Procedural Characteristics: Total amount of contrast used
Procedural Characteristics: Number of participants with additional Vascular procedures performed
Procedural Characteristics: Number of Participants with stent placement performed
Procedural Characteristics: Number of Participants with other Devices used
Procedural Characteristics: Number of non-target lesion treated
measure.description: Additional non-target superficial femoral artery (SFA) lesions: e.g. carotid, renal, subclavian, iliac, opposite limb.

measure.title: Procedural Characteristics: Number of Participants currently taking medication

outcome.title: Composite Rate of Major Adverse Events
outcome.description: Composite rate of major adverse events (MAEs) related to the OffRoad System at 30 days, including: death, perforation requiring intervention, clinically significant peripheral embolism, and major amputation (amputation of the treated lower limb at the ankle level or above). Events are based on data adjudicated by a Clinical Event Committee.
outcome.population: The primary endpoints were analyzed on an intent-to-treat (ITT) basis. All subjects who signed and dated the written Informed Consent Form (ICF) and had any part of the OffRoad System introduced into the body were included in the ITT analysis. 2 participants were not evaluable (No follow-up ≥ 23 days and events-free within 30-day)

group.title: OffRoad Re-entry Catheter
group.description: Participants treated with OffRoad Re-entry Catheter System

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Principal Investigator shall have the right to publish the results, provided that before publishing, the PI shall submit copies of any proposed publication or presentation to Sponsor for review at least 45 days in advance of submission for publication or presentation to a publisher or other third party. Sponsor reserves the right to delete any confidential information or other proprietary information of Sponsor from the proposed publication or presentation.
